## Type of Change
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes)
- [ ] Security fix
- [ ] Configuration change

## Testing
<!-- Describe how you tested these changes -->

### Test Types Completed
- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] Integration tests
- [ ] End-to-end tests
- [ ] Manual testing

- [ ] Security testing

### Test Coverage
- [ ] New code has appropriate test coverage
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] No regression in test coverage

## Quality Checklist

### Code Quality
- [ ] Code follows project style guidelines
- [ ] Self-review completed
- [ ] Code is properly commented
- [ ] No TODO/FIXME comments in production code
- [ ] TypeScript errors resolved
- [ ] ESLint warnings addressed

### Security
- [ ] No hardcoded secrets or sensitive data
- [ ] Input validation implemented where needed
- [ ] Authentication/authorization properly handled
- [ ] SQL injection prevention measures in place

### Performance
- [ ] No performance regressions introduced
- [ ] Database queries optimized
- [ ] Bundle size impact considered
- [ ] Caching strategy implemented where appropriate

### Documentation
- [ ] README updated if needed
- [ ] API documentation updated
- [ ] Inline code documentation added
- [ ] Migration guide provided for breaking changes

## Deployment Considerations
<!-- Any special considerations for deploying this change -->

### Database Changes
- [ ] No database migrations required
- [ ] Database migrations are backward compatible
- [ ] Migration tested on staging
- [ ] Data backup strategy confirmed

### Feature Flags
- [ ] No feature flags needed
- [ ] Feature flags implemented for gradual rollout
- [ ] Feature flag cleanup plan documented

### Rollback Plan
- [ ] Changes are easily reversible
- [ ] Rollback procedure documented
- [ ] Database rollback strategy confirmed

## For Reviewers

### Review Checklist
- [ ] Code logic is sound and efficient
- [ ] Tests are comprehensive and meaningful
- [ ] Documentation is clear and complete
- [ ] Security implications considered
- [ ] Performance impact assessed
- [ ] Breaking changes properly communicated

### Review Focus Areas
<!-- Check areas that need special attention -->
- [ ] Business logic correctness
- [ ] Error handling
- [ ] Edge cases
- [ ] Integration points
- [ ] User experience
- [ ] API contracts

**Note for reviewers:** This PR requires at least one approval from a code owner before merging. All CI checks must pass including quality gates.
